member.name: T:NString.Properties.Resources
member.summary: A strongly-typed resource class, for looking up localized strings, etc.

member.name: P:NString.Properties.Resources.ResourceManager
member.summary: Returns the cached ResourceManager instance used by this class.

member.name: P:NString.Properties.Resources.Culture
member.summary: Overrides the current thread's CurrentUICulture property for all resource lookups using this strongly typed resource class.

member.name: P:NString.Properties.Resources.MaxLengthCantBeLessThan
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to maxLength can't be less than {0}..

member.name: P:NString.Properties.Resources.MaxLengthCantBeLessThanLengthOfEllipsisString
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to maxLength can't be less than the length of ellipsisString..

member.name: P:NString.Properties.Resources.NumberMustBePositiveOrZero
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to {0} must be greater than or equal to zero..

member.name: P:NString.Properties.Resources.SubstringCountOutOfRange
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The number of characters must be greater than or equal to zero, and less than or equal to the length of the string..

member.name: P:NString.Properties.Resources.TemplateKeyNotFound
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to No value found for key '{0}'..

member.name: T:NString.StringExtensions
member.summary: Provides extension methods for strings.

member.name: M:NString.StringExtensions.IsNullOrEmpty(System.String)
member.summary: Indicates whether the specified string is null or an Empty string.
member.param: the string to test
member.returns: true if the value parameter is null or an empty string (""); otherwise, false.
member.remarks: This is just a shortcut for , allowing it to be used as an extension method.

member.name: M:NString.StringExtensions.IsNullOrWhiteSpace(System.String)
member.summary: Indicates whether the specified string is null, empty, or consists only of white-space characters.
member.param: the string to test
member.returns: true if the value parameter is null or String.Empty, or ifvalue consists exclusively of white-space characters.
member.remarks: This is just a shortcut for , allowing it to be used as an extension method.

member.name: M:NString.StringExtensions.Join(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String},System.String)
member.summary: Concatenates all strings in the collection, using the specified separator between each string.
member.param: A collection that contains the strings to concatenate.
The string to use as a separator. separator is included in the returned string only if values has more than one element.
member.returns: A string that consists of the members of values delimited by the separator string. If values has no members, the method returns String.Empty.

member.name: M:NString.StringExtensions.GetLines(System.String)
member.summary: Enumerates all lines in a string.
member.param: The string whose lines are to be enumerated.
member.returns: An enumerable sequence of lines in this string.

member.name: M:NString.StringExtensions.Left(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns a string containing a specified number of characters from the left side of a string.
member.param: The string from which the leftmost characters are returned.
The number of characters to return.
member.exception: count is less than 0 or greater than the length of the string.
member.returns: A string containing a specified number of characters from the left side of a string.

member.name: M:NString.StringExtensions.Right(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns a string containing a specified number of characters from the right side of a string.
member.param: The string from which the rightmost characters are returned.
The number of characters to return.
member.exception: count is less than 0 or greater than the length of the string.
member.returns: A string containing a specified number of characters from the right side of a string.

member.name: M:NString.StringExtensions.Truncate(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns a string truncated to the specified number of characters.
member.param: The string to truncate.
The maximum number of characters to return.
member.returns: A string tuncated to the specified number of characters.

member.name: M:NString.StringExtensions.Capitalize(System.String)
member.summary: Capitalizes a string by making its first character uppercase, using the current culture.
member.param: The string to capitalize.
member.returns: The capitalized string.

member.name: M:NString.StringExtensions.Capitalize(System.String,System.Globalization.CultureInfo)
member.summary: Capitalizes a string by making its first character uppercase, using the specified culture.
member.param: The string to capitalize.
The culture to use when making the first character uppercase.
member.returns: The capitalized string.

member.name: M:NString.StringExtensions.MatchesWildcard(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Checks if a string matches the specified wildcard pattern.
member.param: The string to check.
The pattern against which the string is compared.
true to perform a case-sensitive check; otherwise, false. The default is true.
member.returns: true if the string matches the pattern; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: The pattern can contain wildcards such as '*' (any number of characters) or '?' (exactly one character). This method is not culture-sensitive.

member.name: M:NString.StringExtensions.Ellipsis(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Truncates a string to the specified length, replacing the last characters with an ellipsis (three dots)
member.param: The string to truncate.
The maximum desired length.
member.returns: The truncated string.

member.name: M:NString.StringExtensions.Ellipsis(System.String,System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Truncates a string to the specified length, replacing the last characters with the specified ellipsis string.
member.param: The string to truncate.
The maximum desired length.
The string to use as an ellipsis.
member.exception: maxLength is less than the length of ellipsisString.
member.returns: The truncated string.

member.name: M:NString.StringExtensions.IsValidEmail(System.String)
member.summary: Checks if the specified string is a valid email address.
member.param: The string to check.
member.returns: true if the s is a valid email address; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:NString.StringExtensions.Contains(System.String,System.String,System.StringComparison)
member.summary: Checks if the specified string contains the specified substring, using the specified comparison type.
member.param: The string in which to seek a substring.
The string to seek.
The type of comparison to use.
member.exception: comparisonType is not a valid StringComparison value.
member.returns: true si s contains subString, or if subString is an empty string; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:NString.StringExtensions.ReplaceAt(System.String,System.Int32,System.Char)
member.summary: Replaces a single character at the specified position with the specified replacement character.
member.param: The string in which a character will be replaced.
The position of the character to replace.
The replacement character.
member.exception: index doesn't refer to a valid position within the string.
member.returns: The string with the replaced character.

member.name: M:NString.StringExtensions.Reverse(System.String)
member.summary: Reverses the specified string.
member.param: The string to reverse
member.returns: The string with its characters reversed.
member.remarks: This methods works on full UTF-16 code points, not code units. This means that it will correctly handle surrogate pairs such as emoji or some asian characters.

member.name: T:NString.StringTemplate
member.summary: Provides a string template mechanism with named placeholders that can be used to format objects.
member.remarks: The template syntax is similar to the one used in String.Format, except that indexes are replaced by names.

member.name: M:NString.StringTemplate.Parse(System.String)
member.summary: Parses the provided string into a StringTemplate instance. Parsed templates are cached, so calling this method twice with the same argument will return the same StringTemplate instance.
member.param: string representation of the template
member.returns: A StringTemplate instance that can be used to format objects.
member.remarks: The template syntax is similar to the one used in String.Format, except that indexes are replaced by names.

member.name: M:NString.StringTemplate.op_Implicit(System.String)~NString.StringTemplate
member.summary: Converts a string to a StringTemplate.
member.param: The string to convert
member.returns: A StringTemplate using the converted string

member.name: M:NString.StringTemplate.ToString
member.summary: Returns a string representation of this StringTemplate.
member.returns: The string representation of this StringTemplate

member.name: M:NString.StringTemplate.Format(System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.String,System.Object},System.Boolean,System.IFormatProvider)
member.summary: Replaces the template's placeholders with the values from the specified dictionary.
member.param: A dictionary containing values for each placeholder in the template
Indicates whether or not to throw an exception if a value is missing for a placeholder. If this parameter is false and no value is found, the placeholder is left as is in the formatted string.
An object that supplies culture-specific formatting information.
member.returns: The formatted string
member.exception: throwOnMissingValue is true and no value was found in the dictionary for a placeholder

member.name: M:NString.StringTemplate.Format(System.Object,System.Boolean,System.IFormatProvider)
member.summary: Replaces the template's placeholders with the values from the specified object.
member.param: An object containing values for the placeholders. For each placeholder, this method looks for a corresponding property of field in this object.
Indicates whether or not to throw an exception if a value is missing for a placeholder. If this parameter is false and no value is found, the placeholder is left as is in the formatted string.
An object that supplies culture-specific formatting information.
member.returns: The formatted string
member.exception: throwOnMissingValue is true and no value was found in the dictionary for a placeholder

member.name: M:NString.StringTemplate.Format(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.String,System.Object},System.Boolean,System.IFormatProvider)
member.summary: Replaces the specified template's placeholders with the values from the specified dictionary.
member.param: The template to use to format the values.
A dictionary containing values for each placeholder in the template
Indicates whether or not to throw an exception if a value is missing for a placeholder. If this parameter is false and no value is found, the placeholder is left as is in the formatted string.
An object that supplies culture-specific formatting information.
member.returns: The formatted string
member.exception: throwOnMissingValue is true and no value was found in the dictionary for a placeholder

member.name: M:NString.StringTemplate.Format(System.String,System.Object,System.Boolean,System.IFormatProvider)
member.summary: Replaces the specified template's placeholders with the values from the specified object.
member.param: The template to use to format the values.
An object containing values for the placeholders. For each placeholder, this method looks for a corresponding property of field in this object.
Indicates whether or not to throw an exception if a value is missing for a placeholder. If this parameter is false and no value is found, the placeholder is left as is in the formatted string.
An object that supplies culture-specific formatting information.
member.returns: The formatted string
member.exception: throwOnMissingValue is true and no value was found in the dictionary for a placeholder

member.name: M:NString.StringTemplate.ClearCache
member.summary: Clears the cached templates and property getters.

member.name: T:JetBrains.Annotations.CanBeNullAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that the value of the marked element could be null sometimes, so the check for null is necessary before its usage

member.name: T:JetBrains.Annotations.NotNullAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that the value of the marked element could never be null

member.name: T:JetBrains.Annotations.StringFormatMethodAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that the marked method builds string by format pattern and (optional) arguments. Parameter, which contains format string, should be given in constructor. The format string should be in -like form

member.name: M:JetBrains.Annotations.StringFormatMethodAttribute.#ctor(System.String)
member.param: Specifies which parameter of an annotated method should be treated as format-string

member.name: T:JetBrains.Annotations.InvokerParameterNameAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that the function argument should be string literal and match one of the parameters of the caller function. For example, ReSharper annotates the parameter of

member.name: T:JetBrains.Annotations.NotifyPropertyChangedInvocatorAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that the method is contained in a type that implements interface and this method is used to notify that some property value changed
member.remarks:
The method should be non-static and conform to one of the supported signatures:
NotifyChanged(string)
NotifyChanged(params string[])
NotifyChanged{T}(Expression{Func{T}})
NotifyChanged{T,U}(Expression{Func{T,U}})
SetProperty{T}(ref T, T, string)

member.name: T:JetBrains.Annotations.ContractAnnotationAttribute
member.summary: Describes dependency between method input and output
member.syntax:
Function Definition Table syntax:
FDT ::= FDTRow [;FDTRow]*
FDTRow ::= Input => Output | Output <= Input
Input ::= ParameterName: Value [, Input]*
Output ::= [ParameterName: Value]* {halt|stop|void|nothing|Value}
Value ::= true | false | null | notnull | canbenull
If method has single input parameter, it's name could be omitted.
Using halt (or void/nothing, which is the same) for method output means that the methos doesn't return normally.
canbenull annotation is only applicable for output parameters.
You can use multiple [ContractAnnotation] for each FDT row, or use single attribute with rows separated by semicolon.

item.code: [ContractAnnotation("halt <= condition: false")] public void Assert(bool condition, string text) // regular assertion method
[ContractAnnotation("s:null => true")] public bool IsNullOrEmpty(string s) // string.IsNullOrEmpty()
[ContractAnnotation("s:null=>false; =>true,result:notnull; =>false, result:null")] public bool TryParse(string s, out Person result)

member.name: T:JetBrains.Annotations.LocalizationRequiredAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that marked element should be localized or not

member.name: T:JetBrains.Annotations.CannotApplyEqualityOperatorAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that the value of the marked type (or its derivatives) cannot be compared using '==' or '!=' operators and Equals() should be used instead. However, using '==' or '!=' for comparison with null is always permitted.

member.name: T:JetBrains.Annotations.BaseTypeRequiredAttribute
member.summary: When applied to a target attribute, specifies a requirement for any type marked with the target attribute to implement or inherit specific type or types.

member.name: T:JetBrains.Annotations.UsedImplicitlyAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that the marked symbol is used implicitly (e.g. via reflection, in external library), so this symbol will not be marked as unused (as well as by other usage inspections)

member.name: T:JetBrains.Annotations.MeansImplicitUseAttribute
member.summary: Should be used on attributes and causes ReSharper to not mark symbols marked with such attributes as unused (as well as by other usage inspections)

member.name: F:JetBrains.Annotations.ImplicitUseKindFlags.Access
member.summary: Only entity marked with attribute considered used

member.name: F:JetBrains.Annotations.ImplicitUseKindFlags.Assign
member.summary: Indicates implicit assignment to a member

member.name: F:JetBrains.Annotations.ImplicitUseKindFlags.InstantiatedWithFixedConstructorSignature
member.summary: Indicates implicit instantiation of a type with fixed constructor signature. That means any unused constructor parameters won't be reported as such.

member.name: F:JetBrains.Annotations.ImplicitUseKindFlags.InstantiatedNoFixedConstructorSignature
member.summary: Indicates implicit instantiation of a type

member.name: T:JetBrains.Annotations.ImplicitUseTargetFlags
member.summary: Specify what is considered used implicitly when marked with or

member.name: F:JetBrains.Annotations.ImplicitUseTargetFlags.Members
member.summary: Members of entity marked with attribute are considered used

member.name: F:JetBrains.Annotations.ImplicitUseTargetFlags.WithMembers
member.summary: Entity marked with attribute and all its members considered used

member.name: T:JetBrains.Annotations.PublicAPIAttribute
member.summary: This attribute is intended to mark publicly available API which should not be removed and so is treated as used

member.name: T:JetBrains.Annotations.InstantHandleAttribute
member.summary: Tells code analysis engine if the parameter is completely handled when the invoked method is on stack. If the parameter is a delegate, indicates that delegate is executed while the method is executed. If the parameter is an enumerable, indicates that it is enumerated while the method is executed

member.name: T:JetBrains.Annotations.PureAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that a method does not make any observable state changes. The same as System.Diagnostics.Contracts.PureAttribute

member.name: T:JetBrains.Annotations.PathReferenceAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that a parameter is a path to a file or a folder within a web project. Path can be relative or absolute, starting from web root (~)

member.name: T:JetBrains.Annotations.AspMvcActionAttribute
member.summary: ASP.NET MVC attribute. If applied to a parameter, indicates that the parameter is an MVC action. If applied to a method, the MVC action name is calculated implicitly from the context. Use this attribute for custom wrappers similar to System.Web.Mvc.Html.ChildActionExtensions.RenderAction(HtmlHelper, String)

member.name: T:JetBrains.Annotations.AspMvcAreaAttribute
member.summary: ASP.NET MVC attribute. Indicates that a parameter is an MVC area. Use this attribute for custom wrappers similar to System.Web.Mvc.Html.ChildActionExtensions.RenderAction(HtmlHelper, String)

member.name: T:JetBrains.Annotations.AspMvcControllerAttribute
member.summary: ASP.NET MVC attribute. If applied to a parameter, indicates that the parameter is an MVC controller. If applied to a method, the MVC controller name is calculated implicitly from the context. Use this attribute for custom wrappers similar to System.Web.Mvc.Html.ChildActionExtensions.RenderAction(HtmlHelper, String, String)

member.name: T:JetBrains.Annotations.AspMvcMasterAttribute
member.summary: ASP.NET MVC attribute. Indicates that a parameter is an MVC Master. Use this attribute for custom wrappers similar to System.Web.Mvc.Controller.View(String, String)

member.name: T:JetBrains.Annotations.AspMvcModelTypeAttribute
member.summary: ASP.NET MVC attribute. Indicates that a parameter is an MVC model type. Use this attribute for custom wrappers similar to System.Web.Mvc.Controller.View(String, Object)

member.name: T:JetBrains.Annotations.AspMvcPartialViewAttribute
member.summary: ASP.NET MVC attribute. If applied to a parameter, indicates that the parameter is an MVC partial view. If applied to a method, the MVC partial view name is calculated implicitly from the context. Use this attribute for custom wrappers similar to System.Web.Mvc.Html.RenderPartialExtensions.RenderPartial(HtmlHelper, String)

member.name: T:JetBrains.Annotations.AspMvcSupressViewErrorAttribute
member.summary: ASP.NET MVC attribute. Allows disabling all inspections for MVC views within a class or a method.

member.name: T:JetBrains.Annotations.AspMvcDisplayTemplateAttribute
member.summary: ASP.NET MVC attribute. Indicates that a parameter is an MVC display template. Use this attribute for custom wrappers similar to System.Web.Mvc.Html.DisplayExtensions.DisplayForModel(HtmlHelper, String)

member.name: T:JetBrains.Annotations.AspMvcEditorTemplateAttribute
member.summary: ASP.NET MVC attribute. Indicates that a parameter is an MVC editor template. Use this attribute for custom wrappers similar to System.Web.Mvc.Html.EditorExtensions.EditorForModel(HtmlHelper, String)

member.name: T:JetBrains.Annotations.AspMvcTemplateAttribute
member.summary: ASP.NET MVC attribute. Indicates that a parameter is an MVC template. Use this attribute for custom wrappers similar to System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.UIHintAttribute(System.String)

member.name: T:JetBrains.Annotations.AspMvcViewAttribute
member.summary: ASP.NET MVC attribute. If applied to a parameter, indicates that the parameter is an MVC view. If applied to a method, the MVC view name is calculated implicitly from the context. Use this attribute for custom wrappers similar to System.Web.Mvc.Controller.View(Object)

member.name: T:JetBrains.Annotations.AspMvcActionSelectorAttribute
member.summary: ASP.NET MVC attribute. When applied to a parameter of an attribute, indicates that this parameter is an MVC action name

member.name: T:JetBrains.Annotations.RazorSectionAttribute
member.summary: Razor attribute. Indicates that a parameter or a method is a Razor section. Use this attribute for custom wrappers similar to System.Web.WebPages.WebPageBase.RenderSection(String)

member.name: T:JetBrains.Annotations.NoEnumerationAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that IEnumerable, passed as parameter, is not enumerated.
